text.section:
The provisions of the Maryland General Corporation Law apply to benefit corporations except to the extent that:
The context of a provision clearly requires otherwise; or
A specific provision of this subtitle or another provision of law governing specific classes of corporations provides otherwise.
This subtitle applies only to benefit corporations.

section.section: The existence of a provision of this subtitle does not of itself create any implication that a contrary or different rule of law is or would be applicable to a corporation that is not a benefit corporation.
This subtitle does not affect any statute or rule of law as it applies to a corporation that is not a benefit corporation.

text.section: A provision of the charter or bylaws of a benefit corporation may not be inconsistent with any provision of this subtitle.
